intro: Isocarpha fistulosa, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green hue, and it produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Isocarpha fistulosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
